description: A Late Iron-Age/Romano-British settlement. Excavations identified a rectangular enclosure which included a number of structured-deposits. This enclosure has been tentatively identified as a possible ritual enclosure, and the Rural settlement of Roman Britain project categorised the site type as a shrine.
bibliography: Canterbury Archaeological Trust. “Eddington Phase II Excavations, Interim Report No.3.” [object Object], 2000. https://doi.org/10.5284/1027381.

Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Salt Hill Saltings, Upchurch (Kent).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://archaeologydataservice.ac.uk/archives/view/romangl/fullrecord.cfm?id=9128&display=list.
